cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northward, then north-northeastward parallel to/just inland of the Texas coast toward the upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Port O'Connor–Matagorda Bay area

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of High Island TX to Sabine Pass
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coastline and southwestern Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft forecast for Galveston Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 kt, gusts 55–60 mph) likely beginning Monday evening and persisting through Tuesday night; low (≤10%) chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in Galveston Bay and along the upper TX coast including Texas City, especially around high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches possible with isolated 20 in pockets; significant flash and urban flooding threat for the Houston–Galveston metro area including Texas City.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday–Tuesday; dangerous surf and rip currents.
